newsitem.title: CANADA: FedEx to launch APEC Internet trade database.
newsitem.headline: FedEx to launch APEC Internet trade database.

text.p: Federal Express Corp said it will soon make available a new Internet-based trade and customs database for consolidated tariff and customs related information on the 18 Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation(APEC) forum countries.
The database, developed by Fedex at the request of the U.S.Department of Commerce, will be on the Internet at www.apectariff.org, the express carrier added.
APEC membership spans the Pacific Rim, and includes Canada, the U.S. and countries throughout North and Southeast Asia and the South Pacific.
FedEx said the new database, the outgrowth of a project initiated by the Australian Customs Service in 1994, will provide comprehensive customs and tariff information.
Without such a database, it said, companies can spend days compiling information on which to make trade and investment decisions concerning APEC member countries.
FedEx said the database will offer varying levels of detail according to the needs and tariff expertise of the user. --Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel +44 171 542 7706 Fax + 5017
